name: Rubicon 1993
description: ‘Bordeaux-style standard bearer for nearly two decades. Quiet understatement, free of both forward fruit and weighty, alcoholic Cape statements has been the byword of French-speaking proprietor Myburgh and Dalla Cia. A measured, tasty, grapey vinosity is the hallmark. ‘93 presently still stands apart, with slightly atypical bouquet - curious, intriguing mix of hay stacks and cigar boxes. New Nevers barrel-maturation, about 18 months to 2 years, through malolactic fermentation. About 65-70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20-25% Merlot and rest Cabernet Franc.’ - Platter’s SA Wine Guide 1998, Best of the bunch. Superior Cape Wine  The wines will continue to be cellared at the Meerlust vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal. Rubicon is not produced every year. If a vintage is not produced, the NFT will include the next vintage, to total 50 consecutive vintages
